examples.sentence: Doesn't end in い 静か、便利、有名
Ends in い but can't conjugate きれい、嫌い、有名 (These don't become きれくない, きらくない)
Foreign origin ハンサム (handsome) ロマンチック (romantic)
Two-kanji compound 便利、有名、安全、親切
I-adj: 高い → 高くない ✓
Na-adj: きれい → きれくない ❌ (doesn't work!)

sections.heading: What are Na-adjectives?
sections.content:
Na-adjectives (な形容詞) are adjectives that need な when modifying nouns. They're also called "adjectival nouns" or "nominal adjectives."

静か (shizuka) - quiet きれい (kirei) - beautiful, clean 便利 (benri) - convenient 元気 (genki) - energetic, healthy

children.heading: 1. Need な to Modify Nouns
children.content: 静かな部屋 - quiet room きれいな花 - beautiful flower 便利な店 - convenient store

children.heading: 2. Use だ/です as Copula
children.content: 部屋は静かだ - The room is quiet 部屋は静かです - The room is quiet (polite)

children.heading: 3. Often Foreign Origin or Abstract
children.content:
Many come from Chinese or describe states/qualities:

便利 (benri) - convenient 有名 (yuumei) - famous 簡単 (kantan) - simple

children.heading: State/Condition
children.content: 元気 (genki) - healthy, energetic 病気 (byouki) - sick 暇 (hima) - free (time) 大変 (taihen) - difficult, serious 安全 (anzen) - safe 危険 (kiken) - dangerous 丈夫 (joubu) - sturdy, durable

children.heading: Quality/Characteristic
children.content: 静か (shizuka) - quiet にぎやか (nigiyaka) - lively, bustling きれい (kirei) - beautiful, clean, pretty 汚い... wait! (kitanai) - dirty (i-adjective!) 派手 (hade) - showy, flashy 地味 (jimi) - plain, subdued

children.heading: Ease/Difficulty
children.content: 簡単 (kantan) - simple, easy 複雑 (fukuzatsu) - complex 便利 (benri) - convenient 不便 (fuben) - inconvenient

children.heading: Feelings/Preferences
children.content: 好き (suki) - like 嫌い (kirai) - dislike 大好き (daisuki) - love, really like 大嫌い (daikirai) - hate, really dislike

children.heading: Fame/Reputation
children.content: 有名 (yuumei) - famous 無名 (mumei) - unknown 人気 (ninki) - popular

children.heading: Capability
children.content: 上手 (jouzu) - skilled, good at 下手 (heta) - unskilled, bad at 得意 (tokui) - strong point, good at 苦手 (nigate) - weak point, bad at

children.heading: Size/Scale (Abstract)
children.content: 重要 (juuyou) - important 大切 (taisetsu) - important, precious 必要 (hitsuyou) - necessary 特別 (tokubetsu) - special 普通 (futsuu) - normal, ordinary

children.heading: Personality/Character
children.content: 親切 (shinsetsu) - kind 真面目 (majime) - serious, earnest 素直 (sunao) - obedient, honest わがまま (wagamama) - selfish

children.heading: Appearance
children.content: ハンサム (hansamu) - handsome きれい (kirei) - pretty, beautiful 素敵 (suteki) - lovely, nice

children.heading: 1. Modifying Nouns (+ な)
children.content: 静かな部屋 "quiet room" きれいな花 "beautiful flower" 便利な場所 "convenient place" 有名な人 "famous person"

children.heading: 2. As Predicate (+ だ/です)
children.content: Plain: この部屋は静かだ "This room is quiet" Polite: この部屋は静かです "This room is quiet"

children.heading: 3. Connecting with で
children.content: この部屋は静かで広い "This room is quiet and spacious" 彼女はきれいで親切だ "She's beautiful and kind"

children.heading: Clues it's a Na-adjective:
children.content: Doesn't end in い 静か、便利、有名 Ends in い but can't conjugate きれい、嫌い、有名 (These don't become きれくない, きらくない) Foreign origin ハンサム (handsome) ロマンチック (romantic) Two-kanji compound 便利、有名、安全、親切

children.heading: Words That Trick You
children.content:
End in い but are NA-adjectives:

きれい (kirei) - beautiful → きれいな花 嫌い (kirai) - dislike → 嫌いな食べ物 有名 (yuumei) - famous → 有名な人

How to tell: Try conjugating to negative

I-adj: 高い → 高くない ✓ Na-adj: きれい → きれくない ❌ (doesn't work!)

children.heading: Basic Statement
children.content: この町は静かだ "This town is quiet" 日本語は便利です "Japanese is convenient"

children.heading: Modifying Nouns
children.content: 静かな町 "quiet town" 便利な言語 "convenient language"

children.heading: Question Form
children.content: この町は静かですか？ "Is this town quiet?" 日本は安全ですか？ "Is Japan safe?"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Forgetting な
children.content: Wrong: 静か部屋 ❌ Right: 静かな部屋 ✓ "quiet room" Wrong: きれい花 ❌ Right: きれいな花 ✓ "beautiful flower"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using い-adjective Rules
children.content: Wrong: 静かい ❌ Right: 静かだ ✓ Wrong: 便利い ❌ Right: 便利だ ✓

children.heading: Mistake 3: Adding な to Predicates
children.content: Wrong: 部屋は静かなです ❌ Right: 部屋は静かです ✓ "The room is quiet"

children.heading: Mistake 4: Treating きれい as I-adjective
children.content: Wrong: きれくない ❌ Right: きれいじゃない ✓ "not beautiful" Wrong: きれかった ❌ Right: きれいだった ✓ "was beautiful"

sections.heading: Na-adjectives vs I-adjectives
sections.content: | Na-adjectives | I-adjectives | | -------------- | --------------- | | Need な | Modify directly | | 静かな部屋 | 高い部屋 | | Use だ/です | Use い/いです | | Often abstract | Often concrete | | 静かだ | 高い |

children.heading: Side by Side
children.content: Na-adjective: 静かな図書館 "quiet library" 図書館は静かだ "the library is quiet" I-adjective: 大きい図書館 "big library" 図書館は大きい "the library is big"

children.heading: 好き/嫌い (Like/Dislike)
children.content:
These work differently - object uses が:

私は寿司が好きです "I like sushi" 彼は野菜が嫌いです "He dislikes vegetables"

children.heading: 上手/下手 (Good at/Bad at)
children.content: 彼は日本語が上手です "He's good at Japanese" 私は料理が下手です "I'm bad at cooking"

children.heading: Places
children.content: 静かな場所 "quiet place" にぎやかな街 "lively city" 便利な駅 "convenient station" 有名な観光地 "famous tourist spot"

children.heading: People
children.content: 親切な人 "kind person" 真面目な学生 "serious student" 元気な子供 "energetic child" ハンサムな男性 "handsome man"

children.heading: Things
children.content: 便利な道具 "convenient tool" 丈夫な機械 "sturdy machine" 簡単な問題 "simple problem" 大切な物 "important thing"

children.heading: Example 1: Describing Places
children.content: A: この町はどうですか？ "How is this town?" B: とても静かで便利です "It's very quiet and convenient" A: 駅は近いですか？ "Is the station close?" B: はい、とても便利な場所にあります "Yes, it's in a very convenient location"

children.heading: Example 2: Preferences
children.content: A: 日本料理は好きですか？ "Do you like Japanese food?" B: はい、大好きです "Yes, I love it" A: 何が一番好きですか？ "What do you like most?" B: 寿司が大好きです "I love sushi"

children.heading: Example 3: Describing People
children.content: A: 田中さんはどんな人ですか？ "What kind of person is Tanaka?" B: とても親切な人です "He's a very kind person" A: 日本語は上手ですか？ "Is he good at Japanese?" B: はい、とても上手です "Yes, he's very good"

children.heading: With で
children.content: この部屋は静かで広いです "This room is quiet and spacious" 彼女はきれいで親切です "She's beautiful and kind"

children.heading: Modifying Same Noun
children.content: 静かできれいな部屋 "a quiet and beautiful room" 便利で安全な場所 "a convenient and safe place"

sections.heading: Adverb Form
sections.content:
Add に to make adverb:

静か → 静かに (quietly) きれい → きれいに (beautifully, cleanly) 便利 → 便利に (conveniently) 静かに話す "speak quietly" きれいに書く "write neatly"

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Na-adjectives need な before nouns ✓ Use だ/です as copula ✓ Often abstract or foreign origin ✓ Some end in い (きれい, 嫌い) ✓ Can't conjugate like i-adjectives ✓ Connect with で ✓ Make adverbs with に ✓ 好き/嫌い use が for object

Master na-adjectives - essential for descriptions!

Next: I-adjective Conjugation

Related:

I-adjectives Na-adjective Conjugation Adjective Comparison
